intro: Froelichia gracilis var. drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's frostweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Drummond's frostweed thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
